Hey guys, I've been playing for a year and haven't really dabbled in SSTO's much. recently I tried a whole series of nuclear SSTO's but found out that in order to lift them, you need a massive plane . If you guys have any manageable-sized SSTO's, it would be amazing if you could post some pics! Also, if you are awesome and really feel that way, a craft file?

Thanks!

PS: I would like them to be actual SSTO's, because reasons of reusable space program.
I'm having a lot of trouble with SSTOs as well so i'll be watching for any tips as well.

You should check out Shuttlecraft System Inc.

They have some Small interplanetary (nuke engine) planes. (some are also VTOL's)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/41898-Shuttlecraft-Systems-Inc-%28SSI%29-Your-Auxiliary-Spacecraft-Company%21
I actually have a nearly working design, but have no idea how to post pictures directly from a mac:huh:. So I don't really need a company, just tips. Thanks anyway!

-410 units of fuel.

-1 nuke.

-1 turbojet.

Those 3 things will get you a return trip from the Mun.
My first proper SSTO can't even do a Mun flyby. Its huge as well.

This is my advanced three stage design:

The first stage are turbojets, second stage is LV-N + 2x 48-7S's for emergencies in case one LV-N is not enough and the third is nuclear only. I could've added a third turbojet but it works just fine this way.

Long range? I recently made just that. It goes to Laythe & Duna & back on one trip.

It consists of a whole 494 parts...but that's cause I wanted to carry a four-passenger module with me ;P

Be sure to avoid using buttons A and D while in atmospere. Certain death guaranteed. If you really wanna turn, roll the plane about 45~90 degrees degrees and pull up.

I could have made it more user friendly, but that would require even more parts! My calculator could't possibly handle that.

Special thanks to Cupcake, 1greywind, and overfloater. I will probably leave this thread up for a bit to gather more inspiration.

Oddly enough, I named my most recent SSTO : Long Ranged SSTO.

Powered by 4 Turbojets and 1 Nerva with plenty of airhogged intakes. It's using two tanks with T-joint, that seems to be giving it more lifts. It's meant to go interplanetary and drop a lander to grab science points and dock back to the spaceplane in orbit. I tested it going to Mun and Minmus and back with plenty of dV. I'm not really sure how to read the dV chart but it seems to have around 2600-2900 dV for the Nerva engine, which should be plenty to get you to Duna.

Once you get the hang of it, SSTO is fun to build but harder to make it pleasing to the eyes. Because you can make them so convoluted with intakes and wings that it looks like Meh.... Currently messing with my payload lander capsule to look better. If anyone has any tips.
